results.title: The Big one
results.creator_credit: Michael Moore, Kathleen Glynn, BBC, Dog Eat Dog Films, Mayfair Entertainment International and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Michael Moore, this is a documentary account of Moore travelling across America to promote his most recent book “Downsize this: random threats from an unarmed American”. Moore, unbeknown to the book’s publishers, gathers a film crew to follow him as he gives public lectures, signs books and gives surprise visits to large corporations. Moore challenges some executives at large companies asking why they are ‘downsizing’ staff in a time of record profits. He visits not only large cities but also some small towns - including one town that was listed as the worst in America. He talks to workers and townsfolk who are trying to live on minimum wage and those who have not had pay increases in many, many years. Large factories are closing down across America as companies use cheaper overseas labour in their manufacturing processes. Only one CEO agrees to an interview, the head of Nike, and he does not provide Michael with a happy ending to his film - Nike shoes are not manufactured in America and are made by teenage workers in Indonesia (minimum age of 14) - something the CEO has no problem with. Using his unique mix of humour, compassion and outright brashness, Moore has created a glimpse into the social and political climate in America in the late 1990s.

results.title: The Big combo
results.creator_credit: Joseph Lewis, Sidney Harmon and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: This is not just another gangster movie, but far more a private obsessional duel, a battle of wills between a smooth-tongued gangster and a fixated cop, which is resolved in terms of individual foibles and motivations. The film deals with a new brand of corporate business-minded gangster. The film’s two main characters (Leonard Diamond and Mr. Brown) run along parallel lines: both are haunted by chimeras of innocence, they are both aggressive in the pursuit of their differing ambitions. Stars Cornel Wilde, Richard Conte, Brian Donlevy, Jean Wallace.

results.title: The Big backyard: the outback of South Australia
results.creator_credit: Igor Auzins, Peter Dimond and Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: A young couple, on their honeymoon, travel in a four-wheel drive vehicle to the north and north-eastern areas of South Australia On their journey they see many points of interest including the opal mines of Coober Pedy, Lake Eyre, the Birdsville Track and Sturt’s Stony Desert and the varying barren landscapes of the outback of Australia. Cast: Christina Mackay and Bill Cain. Photographer: David Foreman.

results.title: The Best of The Two Ronnies
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitmore and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This is classic British humor featuring a compilation of sketches, old and new, from the British television show “The Two Ronnies”. Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett are two very clever, very funny comedians who compliment each other with perfect timing and an amazing use of, and play on, words. Their popular partnership has entertained audiences throughout the world and this video provides a sample of that wonderful unique sense of the ridiculous through the following sketches: Harry and Bert down the pub; Cinema commissionaire; Ice cream parlour sketch; Barber’s shop medley; Optician’s sketch; A life on the ocean waves medley and of course, The News. Written by: John Hyde, Spike Mullins, Gerald Wiley. Cast includes: Paul McDowell, Sam Kelly, Martin Duncan.

results.title: The BFG
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall and Cosgrove-Hall Productions
results.brief_description: Adapted from Roald Dahl’s best-selling children’s book, this animated feature tells the story of Sophie, a little orphan girl and her friend, the Big Friendly Giant (the BFG). Sophie and the BFG set out to rid the world of the gruesome “crunching giants” who gobble up children for breakfast. Sophie decides the only person powerful enough to help them is the Queen of England - but will she help?

results.title: The Best of liquid television
results.creator_credit: Nick Litwinko, Prudence Fenton, MTV Music Television and MTV Networks
results.brief_description: A feast of amazing animation from MTV’s ‘Liquid Television’ which features animated comics, live actors in animated settings and short films from a host of artists and multimedia creators.

results.title: The Best of BBC golf
results.brief_description: Golf lovers have been highly rewarded over the years by the excellent golf coverage of the BBC team. Now the greatest highlights have been recorded in one program. Alex Hay presents memorable moments from four decades of top international golf.

results.title: The Best of the original D Generation
results.brief_description: A selection of comedy sketches from the earliest years of one of Australia’s most original and inventive comedy teams - the D Generation. Originally discovered at a Melbourne comedy venue by an ABC producer, this young team of Melbourne University students went on to produce some of the most unique and memorable moments in Australian comedy, including The Late Show, Fast Forward and Frontline. Screened on the ABC over 10 years ago this compilation contains the sketches: the awesome scope of “The Making of Chisolm”, the baffling, enigmatic “Yellow thing with hinges”, gasp at the fashions in “Dag City” and reminisce with “Fart-Whistles”, “The Tense Family”, “Hijack Bloopers”, “The Discoverers”, the classic “Thunderbirds” and much more. Featuring Santo Cilauro, Marg Downey, John Harrison, Rob Sitch, Magda Szubanski and Michael Veitch.

results.title: The Best of the Big Gig (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Madness, mayhem and tons of laughs from the infamous Big Gig team, with all the best bits taken from their first series and cleverly put together on one video. Hosted by Wendy Harmer and including such favourites as Glynn Nicholas, Jean Kitson, The Empty Pockets, Anthony Ackroyd and the Doug Anthony Allstars.

results.title: The Best bits of the Late Show Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Joe Murray, Mark Gibson, ABC-TV (Australia), D Generation and Michael Hirsch
results.brief_description: Finally all the ‘classic’ Logie-winning moments from the Logie-winning second series of the Logie-winning D-Generation’s Logie-winning ‘The Late Show’. See such cult classics as: Shitscared, Glengarry Glenn Ridge, Charlie the Wonderdog, Schwarzenegger’s Citizen Kane, The Oz Brothers, Mick’s underpants, Street interviews galore, spectacular, musical finals, including Joan Kirner doing Joan Jett, plus dozens more ‘Champagne Comedy’ sketches.
